name: TheAtlantic
text: "I remember all of the faces of those lost‚Äîthe thousands of other stories I‚Äôve read and cried over throughout this pandemic. Each one of these people meant the world to someone. Every one of their lives had meaning," @alexjgoldstein writes: https://t.co/TCxqHJOiaa

name: TheAtlantic
text: The director of "Up" and "Inside Out" has made another cerebral adventure with Pixar's "Soul," an ambitious animated tale about the meaning of existence, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/7mOUlWlsu9

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @NickBaumann: ‚ÄúEmma? This is Santa speaking.‚Äù True story I woke up sweating at 4 a.m. and realized I had scheduled this story with a default tweet calling Santa an 'elf' that would inevitably prompt Christmas correction emails.

Good morning! @emmaogreen spoke to Santa: https://t.co/2kC2hzllJT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Emma? This Is Santa Speaking." But even Santa can‚Äôt make the coronavirus go away. @emmaogreen talks to the man himself: https://t.co/0p1vqC4hJY

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Uncanny Valley," "Transcendent Kingdom," "Wow, No Thank You," and more are among the year's best books, in this week's #TheAtlanticBooksBriefing. From editors and writers on the Atlantic's Culture team: https://t.co/J3X9qFwkmV

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: Me to my editor: I just had a dream about interviewing a department-store Santa about COVID. So...?

@NickBaumann: Yes. 

If your Christmas wish, like mine, was to know whether Zoom Santa does Ho Ho on top and sweatpants down below (and more!!), read on:

https://t.co/NsD2P7CetA
